title: Coolant Level Adjustment

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

Do not remove the expansion tank or coolant pressure cap when the engine is hot. When the engine is hot, the coolant inside the cooling system will be hot and may also be under pressure. Contact with hot coolant will cause scalds and skin damage.
Coolant level adjustment DB; DBX; DC; DC3; DP; DP2; DP3; DPA; DT3; DU; DU3; DUY; DZ
Allow the engine to cool for a minimum of 30 minutes.
Remove the cap from the expansion tank, and add coolant mixture through the filler opening until the level reaches the MAX mark. Refit the cap.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DU3; DT3; DZ; DUY; DU; DC3; DC; DBX; DB; DP3; DP2; DPA; DP

body.body: If the coolant level is being checked because the coolant has overheated, also check the level in the radiator and top up if necessary.
In an emergency, distilled water can be added to the cooling system. However, the coolant must then be drained and replenished with HD4X Hybrid OAT coolant as soon as possible.
